2018 2019

Expo

Text goes here.

2019

Expo

22 October

At the CS3STHLM Expo 2019, an ICS Cyber Security Expo in Stockholm, you will get an overview of threats and different protection that's available on the market. Here you will meet both researchers, vendors and experts who share their experiences of best practice and trends in IT security for critical parts of society.

CS3STHLM Expo enables companies and organisations to network, demonstrate valuable experiences products and services, via workshops and presentations. The Expo offer a place for valuable discussions and to experience success-stories from around the globe. Moreover it's an excellent opportunity for networking among peers in the industry, meet security experts as well as representatives from governmental agencies and organisations.

Presentations

Anton Shipulin

Kaspersky Lab

How to save $1.7 million over three years on industrial cybersecurity: the Results of the Forrester Total Economic (TEI) Impact study

Henrik Sandberg

KTH Royal Institute

Testbed Evaluation of DoS Attacks on Continuously Controlled Processes

Magnus Lundgren

Recorded Future

We are all vulnerable

Mathias Ekstedt

KTH Royal Institute

Applying automated attack modeling to a smart grid use case

Michael Weng

Nozmi Networks

Cyber Security for OT/IIoT/ICS – what we have learned 1000 installations later

Robert Bearsby

F-Secure Consulting

Attack Path Mapping

Robert Lagerström

KTH Royal Institute

Project EnergyShield - hacking the power grid as a research method

Partners

2018

Expo

23 October

At the CS3STHLM Expo 2018, an ICS Cyber Security Expo in Stockholm, you will get an overview of threats and different protection that's available on the market. Here you will meet both researchers, vendors and experts who share their experiences of best practice and trends in IT security for critical parts of society.

CS3STHLM Expo enables companies and organisations to network, demonstrate valuable experiences products and services, via workshops and presentations. The Expo offer a place for valuable discussions and to experience success-stories from around the globe. Moreover it's an excellent opportunity for networking among peers in the industry, meet security experts as well as representatives from governmental agencies and organisations.

Presentations

Anton Shipulin

Kaspersky Lab

Kaspersky Industrial Cybersecurity approach

Dr Kevin Jones

Airbus Group

ICS cyber security in the face of digital transformation

György Dán

KTH Royal Institute

Resilient Computing and Communication for Critical Infrastructures

Henrik Sandberg

KTH Royal Institute

Control Theory for Practical Cyber-Physical Security

Jannis Utz

Recorded Future

Recorded Future - The Dark Web’s deep threat intelligence secrets

Jonas Dellenvall

Advenica

Security when failure is not an option

Mads Dam

KTH Royal Institute

Securing Low Level Software Using Formal Methods

Ragnar Thobaben

KTH Royal Institute

Securing Wireless Transmissions at the Air Interface

Rick K. Peters

Fortinet

Addressing Physical to Digital Convergence in an Evolving World
